content: Does anyone know if Zulip supports Postgres schemas?
@Dennis Payonk what specifically do you have in mind?
We use postgres via Django's standard integration, and thus do use a postgres schema; we don't currently have an application for more than 1
I was looking to use an already existing database to install zulip into, but separating it out with a specific schema
ahh, I think by default it runs in a "zulip" schema
yeah, in a database named zulip by default too
if you can successfully send_test_email from these instructions, https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/prod-install.html should the create realm email functionality use the same credentials?
I think I may need to restart the server...this may be silly, but how do I do that for zulip in supervisor? Theres quite a few agents running
